title: The Great British Bake Off: Pastry Week recap – did the latest departure really deserve it?
text:
It was quarter-final time in the tent of doughy dreams and the theme was Pastry Week. Who’d go flaky and who’d be a choux-in?

Henry’s exit seemed harsh

Oh, Henry. Groans were almost audible around the country as many viewers’ favourite remaining baker, endearingly gawky student Henry Bird, fell victim to the dreaded “curse of Star Baker” and departed the tent.

It all started so well. His signature Crab, New Potato & Tomato Tarte Tatin was so tasty that Prue Leith ate the leftovers for her lunch. High praise indeed. In fact, with Paul Hollywood stealing Henry’s ham, this was a week for particularly peckish judges. Surely Love Productions aren’t skimping on the catering with a cash cow like Bake...
description: It was quarter-final time in the tent of doughy dreams and the theme was Pastry Week.
